section.heading: Definitions.

content.p: As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires, the words and terms defined inNRS 482.0105to482.137, inclusive, have the meanings ascribed to them in those sections.

section.heading: ï¿½Assemblyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Assemblyï¿½ means a combination of parts assembled together in such a way as to create a complete part.

section.heading: ï¿½Autocycleï¿½ defined. [Effective on the date on which the Director of the Department of Motor Vehicles notifies the Governor and the Director of the Legislative Counsel Bureau that sufficient resources are available to enable the Department to carry out the amendatory provisions of chapter 233,Statutes of Nevada 2023, at page 1468, which relate to autocycles.]

content.p: Does not require the operator or passengers to straddle or sit astride the vehicle; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Has been manufactured to meet the federal safety requirements for a motorcycle.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (Added to NRS by2023, 1470, effective on the date on which the Director of the Department of Motor Vehicles notifies the Governor and the Director of the Legislative Counsel Bureau that sufficient resources are available to enable the Department to carry out the amendatory provisions of chapter 233,Statutes of Nevada 2023, at page 1468, which relate to autocycles)

section.heading: ï¿½Basedï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Basedï¿½ means the place or domicile where a vehicle is primarily used, or if a vehicle is often used in more than one county, then it means the place or domicile where the vehicle is primarily stored or kept. A vehicle registered for intercounty or interstate operation under the provisions ofchapter 706of NRS shall be deemed to have no base.

section.heading: ï¿½Border state employeeï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Border state employeeï¿½ means a person whose legal residence is not in this State, who resides outside of the State of Nevada and who commutes on a daily basis into the State of Nevada solely for the purpose of employment at a place of employment which is less than 35 air miles from the state border.

section.heading: ï¿½Branchï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Branchï¿½ means an established place of business of a vehicle dealer or long-term or short-term lessor at which the dealer or long-term or short-term lessor conducts business simultaneously with, and physically separated from, his or her principal established place of business.

section.heading: ï¿½Brokerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Brokerï¿½ means a person who, for a fee or any other consideration, offers to provide to another person the service of arranging, negotiating or assisting in the purchase of a new or used vehicle which has not been registered or for which an ownership interest has not been taken by the broker.

section.heading: ï¿½Busï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Busï¿½ means any motor vehicle designed for carrying more than 10 passengers and used for the transportation of persons, and every motor vehicle, other than a taxicab, designed and used for transportation of persons for compensation.

section.heading: ï¿½Calendar yearï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Calendar yearï¿½ means a year commencing at 12 p.m. December 31 and ending at 12 p.m. the following December 31.

section.heading: ï¿½Charitable organizationï¿½ defined.

content.p: The Secretary of the Treasury has determined is an exempt organization pursuant to the provisions of section 501
of the Internal Revenue Code; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For not less than 2 years, has held a certificate of organization or has been qualified by the Secretary of State to conduct business in this State.

section.heading: ï¿½Chassis-mount camperï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Chassis-mount camperï¿½ means a portable unit designed to be permanently affixed to a truck chassis and cab, and so constructed as to provide temporary living quarters for travel, camping or recreational use.

section.heading: ï¿½Combined gross vehicle weightï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Combined gross vehicle weightï¿½ means the actual weight of a commercial motor vehicle, including any load the vehicle is carrying, combined with the actual weight of any trailer or load the vehicle is towing.

section.heading: ï¿½Combined gross vehicle weight ratingï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Combined gross vehicle weight ratingï¿½ means the maximum gross weight, as designated by the manufacturer, that a vehicle is capable of towing in combination with its own gross vehicle weight rating.

section.heading: ï¿½Complete front inner structure for a unibodyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Complete front inner structure for a unibodyï¿½ means the weld-on structure of a vehicle, including, without limitation, the radiator support, left and right aprons, upper and lower rails and strut towers, designed and intended to be located forward of the cowl assembly.

section.heading: ï¿½Conventional frameï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Conventional frameï¿½ means the main longitudinal structural members of the chassis of a vehicle used as the major support in the construction of the vehicle.

section.heading: ï¿½Converter dollyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Converter dollyï¿½ means a vehicle with a fifth wheel lower half or equivalent mechanism, the attachment of which converts a semitrailer to a full trailer.

section.heading: ï¿½Cowl assemblyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Cowl assemblyï¿½ means the forward structural portion of a vehicle to which are intended to be attached all or a part of the windshield frame, fire wall, housing of the instrument panel and hinges for the front doors.

section.heading: ï¿½Dealerï¿½ and ï¿½vehicle dealerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Dealerï¿½ or ï¿½vehicle dealerï¿½ means any person who: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For compensation, money or other thing of value sells, exchanges, buys, offers or displays for sale, negotiates or attempts to negotiate a sale or exchange of an interest in a vehicle subject to registration under this chapter or induces or attempts to induce any person to buy or exchange an interest in a vehicle; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Represents that he or she has the ability to sell, exchange, buy or negotiate the sale or exchange of an interest in a vehicle subject to registration under this chapter or in any other state or territory of the United States; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Receives or expects to receive a commission, money, brokerage fee, profit or any other thing of value from the seller or purchaser of a vehicle; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Is engaged wholly or in part in the business of selling vehicles or buying or taking in trade vehicles for the purpose of resale, selling or offering for sale or consignment to be sold or otherwise dealing in vehicles, whether or not he or she owns the vehicles. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Dealerï¿½ or ï¿½vehicle dealerï¿½ does not include: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An insurance company, bank, finance company, government agency or any other person coming into possession of a vehicle, acquiring a contractual right to a vehicle or incurring an obligation with respect to a vehicle in the performance of official duties or under the authority of any court of law, if the sale of the vehicle is for the purpose of saving the seller from loss or pursuant to the authority of a court of competent jurisdiction; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person, other than a long-term or short-term lessor, who is not engaged in the purchase or sale of vehicles as a business, but is disposing of vehicles acquired by the owner for his or her use and not for the purpose of avoiding the provisions of this chapter, or a person who sells not more than three personally owned vehicles in any 12-month period; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Persons regularly employed as salespersons by dealers, licensed under this chapter, while those persons are acting within the scope of their employment; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Persons who are incidentally engaged in the business of soliciting orders for the sale and delivery of vehicles outside the territorial limits of the United States if their sales of such vehicles produce less than 5 percent of their total gross revenue; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Persons who sell kit trailers but no other vehicle defined by this chapter.

section.heading: ï¿½Declared gross weightï¿½ defined.

content.p: Implements of husbandry; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Towable tools or equipment, as that term is defined inNRS 484D.055; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The load on a farm vehicle which has an unladen weight of 10,000 pounds or more.

section.heading: ï¿½Distributorï¿½ defined; exception.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided inNRS 482.36318, ï¿½distributorï¿½ means a person, other than a manufacturer, who is engaged in the business of selling new motor vehicles to dealers.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (Added to NRS by1981, 189; A2003, 20th Special Session, 299)

section.heading: ï¿½Duplicate number plateï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Duplicate number plateï¿½ means a license plate or a set of license plates issued to a registered owner which repeats the code of a plate or set of plates previously issued to the owner to maintain the registration using the same code.

section.heading: ï¿½Electric bicycleï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Electric bicycleï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 484B.017. The term does not include a moped or an electric scooter.

section.heading: Electric personal assistive mobility deviceï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Electric personal assistive mobility deviceï¿½ means a self-balancing, two nontandem wheeled device, designed to transport only one person, with an electric propulsion system that limits the maximum speed of the device to 15 miles per hour or less.

section.heading: ï¿½Electric scooterï¿½ defined.

content.p: With handlebars and an electric motor that is designed to be ridden on in an upright or seated position and is propelled by its electric motor or by propulsion provided by the rider; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That does not weigh more than 100 pounds without a rider; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That has a maximum speed of not more than 20 miles per hour when powered solely by its electric motor.

section.heading: ï¿½Essential partsï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Essential partsï¿½ means all integral parts and body parts, the removal, alteration or substitution of which will tend to conceal the identity or substantially alter the appearance of the vehicle.

section.heading: ï¿½Farm tractorï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Farm tractorï¿½ means every motor vehicle designed and used primarily as a farm implement for drawing plows, mowing machines and other implements of husbandry.

section.heading: ï¿½Farm vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: Used to transport livestock, agricultural products, or ranch or farm machinery or supplies to or from a ranch or farm; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Not used in the operation of a common motor carrier or contract motor carrier.

section.heading: ï¿½Fiscal yearï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Fiscal yearï¿½ means a year commencing at 12 p.m. June 30 and ending at 12 p.m. the following June 30.

section.heading: ï¿½Floor pan assemblyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Floor pan assemblyï¿½ means the pans designed and intended to form the floor of the passenger compartment of a vehicle.

section.heading: ï¿½Foreign vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Foreign vehicleï¿½ means every motor vehicle, trailer or semitrailer which has been brought into this State otherwise than in the ordinary course of business by or through a manufacturer or dealer and which has not been registered in this State. The term does not include a retired military vehicle which is registered pursuant toNRS 482.3817.

section.heading: ï¿½Franchiseï¿½ defined.

content.p: A commercial relationship of definite duration or continuing indefinite duration is established. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The dealer is granted the right to offer and sell at retail new vehicles, other than mopeds, farm tractors or special mobile equipment. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The dealer constitutes a component of a distribution system for new vehicles. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The operation of the dealerï¿½s business is substantially associated with the trademark, trade name, advertising or other commercial symbol designating a manufacturer or distributor. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The operation of a portion of the dealerï¿½s business is substantially reliant on the manufacturer or distributor for a continued supply of new vehicles, parts and accessories.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (Added to NRS by1981, 189; A1983, 838;2003, 20th Special Session, 299)

section.heading: ï¿½Full trailerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Full trailerï¿½ means any commercial vehicle without motive power supported by front and rear axles and pulled by a drawbar.

section.heading: ï¿½Golf cartï¿½ defined.

content.p: Has no fewer than three wheels in contact with the ground; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is designed to carry golf equipment and no more than four persons, including the driver.

section.heading: ï¿½Gross vehicle weightï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Gross vehicle weightï¿½ means the actual weight of a commercial motor vehicle, including any load the vehicle is carrying.

section.heading: ï¿½Gross vehicle weight ratingï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Gross vehicle weight ratingï¿½ means the maximum gross weight, as designated by the manufacturer, at which a vehicle is capable of being operated, including any load the vehicle is capable of carrying but excluding any weight the vehicle is capable of towing.

section.heading: ï¿½Highwayï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Highwayï¿½ means the entire width between the boundary lines of every way maintained by a public authority when any part of such way is open to the use of the public for purposes of vehicular traffic.

section.heading: ï¿½Identificationï¿½ and ï¿½permanent identifyingï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Identificationï¿½ or ï¿½permanent identifyingï¿½ as used in this chapter with respect to the number of a vehicle subject to registration under this chapter shall, for the purpose of the registration or departmental record thereof, or any evidence of such registration, be construed to mean such identification, or permanent identifying number of any vehicle which the manufacturer thereof may, in its discretion, adopt or has adopted as an identification or permanent identifying number of the vehicles manufactured by it, or which the Director may approve as the identification number, in lieu of or in addition to a motor number or serial number or a motor and serial number.

section.heading: ï¿½Kit trailerï¿½ defined.

content.p: Does not exceed 6 feet in width and 8 feet in length once assembled; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Does not weigh more than 250 pounds unladen.

section.heading: ï¿½Lease,ï¿½ ï¿½long-term lessee,ï¿½ ï¿½long-term lessor,ï¿½ ï¿½short-term lesseeï¿½ and ï¿½short-term lessorï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Leaseï¿½ means a contract by which the lienholder or owner of a vehicle transfers to another person, for compensation, the right to use such vehicle but does not include the sharing of a vehicle through a peer-to-peer car sharing program pursuant tochapter 482Cof NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Long-term lesseeï¿½ means a person who has leased a vehicle from another person for a fixed period of more than 31 days. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Long-term lessorï¿½ means a person who has leased a vehicle to another person for a fixed period of more than 31 days. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Short-term lesseeï¿½ means a person who has leased a vehicle from another person for a period of 31 days or less, or by the day, or by the trip. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Short-term lessorï¿½ means a person who has leased a vehicle to another person for a period of 31 days or less, or by the day, or by the trip.

section.heading: ï¿½Lienholderï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Lienholderï¿½ means a person who holds a security interest in a vehicle and whose name appears on the certificate of title as legal owner.

section.heading: ï¿½Local authorityï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Local authorityï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 484A.115.

section.heading: ï¿½Manufacturerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Manufacturerï¿½ means every person engaged in the business of manufacturing motor vehicles, trailers or semitrailers.

section.heading: ï¿½Metal tiresï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Metal tiresï¿½ means all tires the surface of which in contact with the highway is wholly or partly of metal or other hard, nonresilient material.

section.heading: ï¿½Mini motor homeï¿½ defined.

content.p: A structure attached permanently on a self-propelled chassis; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A portable unit designed to be affixed permanently to a truck chassis with cab, ï¿½which is designated as a mini motor home by the manufacturer.

section.heading: ï¿½Mobile homeï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Mobile homeï¿½ means a vehicular structure, built on a chassis or frame, which is designed to be used with or without a permanent foundation and is capable of being drawn by a motor vehicle. It may be used as a dwelling when connected to utilities or may be used permanently or temporarily for the advertising, sales, display or promotion of merchandise or services. The term does not include a recreational park trailer.

section.heading: ï¿½Mopedï¿½ defined.

content.p: Is designed to travel on not more than three wheels in contact with the ground but is not a tractor; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Is capable of a maximum speed of not more than 30 miles per hour on a flat surface with not more than 1 percent grade in any direction when the motor is engaged. ï¿½The term does not include an electric bicycle or an electric scooter.

section.heading: ï¿½Motorcycleï¿½ defined. [Effective until the date on which the Director of the Department of Motor Vehicles notifies the Governor and the Director of the Legislative Counsel Bureau that sufficient resources are available to enable the Department to carry out the amendatory provisions of chapter 233,Statutes of Nevada 2023, at page 1468, which relate to autocycles.]

content.p: ï¿½Motorcycleï¿½ means every motor vehicle designed to travel on not more than three wheels in contact with the ground, except any such vehicle as may be included within the term ï¿½electric bicycle,ï¿½ ï¿½electric scooter,ï¿½ ï¿½tractorï¿½ or ï¿½mopedï¿½ as defined in this chapter.

section.heading: ï¿½Motor homeï¿½ defined.

content.p: Designed as a temporary dwelling for travel, recreational or camping use; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
When assembled for the road, has a maximum body width of 102 inches.

section.heading: ï¿½Motortruckï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Motortruckï¿½ means every motor vehicle designed, used or maintained primarily for the transportation of property.

section.heading: ï¿½Motor vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Motor vehicleï¿½ means every vehicle as defined inNRS 482.135which is self-propelled. The term does not include an electric bicycle or an electric scooter.

section.heading: ï¿½New vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: That has never been registered with the Department and has never been registered with the appropriate agency of authority of any other state, the District of Columbia, any territory or possession of the United States or foreign state, province or country; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For which a certificate of title has never been issued by the Department or by the appropriate agency of authority of any other state, the District of Columbia, any territory or possession of the United States or foreign state, province or country; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That has been so registered or for which a certificate of title has been so issued, if the vehicle is equipped with an odometer that registers 2,500 miles or less.

section.heading: ï¿½New vehicle dealerï¿½ defined.

content.p: Vehicle dealer licensed under the provisions of this chapter as a new vehicle dealer who has a franchise from a manufacturer of vehicles to sell new vehicles and who acquires new or new and used vehicles for resale; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Manufacturer described inNRS 482.36349that is licensed under the provisions of this chapter as a new vehicle dealer.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (Added to NRS by1965, 1471; A1975, 1071;2014, 28th Special Session, 4)

section.heading: ï¿½Nonresidentï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Nonresidentï¿½ means every person who is not a resident of this State, and who does not use his or her motor vehicle for a gainful purpose.

section.heading: ï¿½Out-of-service orderï¿½ defined.

content.p: By a federal or state entity with authority to issue such a temporary prohibition; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Pursuant to a provision of 49 C.F.R. Part 385 or 386 that is specified in regulations adopted pursuant toNRS 482.2914.

section.heading: ï¿½Out-of-state studentï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Out-of-state studentï¿½ means a student whose legal residence is not in this State and who comes into Nevada for the purpose of attending an educational institution.

section.heading: ï¿½Ownerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Ownerï¿½ means a person who holds the legal title of a vehicle and whose name appears on the certificate of title, and any lienholder whose name appears on the certificate of title. If a vehicle is the subject of an agreement for the conditional sale or lease thereof with or without the right of purchase upon performance of the conditions stated in the agreement and with an immediate right of possession vested in the conditional vendee or lessee, or if a mortgagor of a vehicle is entitled to possession, then the conditional vendee or lessee or mortgagor shall be deemed the owner for the purpose of this chapter.

section.heading: ï¿½Passenger carï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Passenger carï¿½ means a motor vehicle designed for carrying 10 persons or less, except a motorcycle, an electric bicycle, an electric scooter or a moped.

section.heading: ï¿½Passenger compartmentï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Passenger compartmentï¿½ means the area of a vehicle designed and intended for the seating of the driver and passengers.

section.heading: ï¿½Pneumatic tiresï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Pneumatic tiresï¿½ means all tires inflated with compressed air.

section.heading: ï¿½Purchase priceï¿½ defined.

content.p: If no security interest is taken, retained, created or in existence by virtue of a sale of a vehicle in this State, the price of the vehicle plus any additional included amounts for taxes, official fees, registration fees, transfer of title fees, delivery charges, installation charges, servicing charges, repair charges, alteration charges and improvement charges, or any of them. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If a security interest is taken, retained, created or in existence by virtue of a sale of a vehicle in this State, the amounts specified in subsection 1 plus any time price differential included in the security agreement or the obligation which it secures.

section.heading: ï¿½Qualifying service-connected disabilityï¿½ defined.

content.p: More than one service-connected disability, the combined ratings of which add up to at least 100 percent; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A service-connected disability of any rating that constitutes or includes a permanent disability that qualifies a person for a special license plate pursuant toNRS 482.384.

section.heading: ï¿½Rear clip assemblyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Rear clip assemblyï¿½ means the entire rear structural portion of a vehicle designed and intended to be located behind the rear seat of the vehicle.

section.heading: ï¿½Rebuilderï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Rebuilderï¿½ means a person engaged in the: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Business of reconstructing motor vehicles by the alteration, addition or substitution of substantial or essential parts; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Assembling of replica or specially constructed vehicles from unassembled parts. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Nothing in this section shall be construed to require any licensed new or used vehicle dealer to secure a license as a rebuilder in conjunction with rebuilding in his or her own facilities.

section.heading: ï¿½Rebuilt vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Rebuilt vehicleï¿½ means a vehicle: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That is a salvage vehicle as that term is defined inNRS 487.770, excluding a nonrepairable vehicle; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

One or more major components of which have been replaced as set forth in this subsection. For the purposes of this subsection, the requisite major components of a vehicle which must be replaced for a vehicle to be considered rebuilt are the: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Cowl assembly; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Rear clip assembly; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Roof assembly; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Floor pan assembly; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Conventional frame coupled with one additional major component; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Complete front inner structure for a unibody. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The term does not include a vehicle for which the only change is the installation of a truck cab assembly. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For the purposes of this section, ï¿½replacedï¿½ means the substitution, or change in whole, of a new, used or after-market part of a vehicle.

section.heading: ï¿½Reconstructed vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Reconstructed vehicleï¿½ means any vehicle which shall have been assembled or constructed largely by means of essential parts, new or used, derived from other vehicles or makes of vehicles of various names, models or types, or which, if originally otherwise constructed, shall have been materially altered by the removal of essential parts or by the addition or substitution of essential parts, new or used, derived from other vehicles or makes of vehicles.

section.heading: ï¿½Recreational park trailerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Recreational park trailerï¿½ means a vehicle which is primarily designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational, camping or seasonal use and which: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Has a gross trailer area not exceeding 400 square feet in the set-up mode; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is certified by the manufacturer as complying with Standard No. A119.5 of the American National Standards Institute. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Nothing in this section shall be construed to mean that a recreational park trailer is a vehicle which must be registered pursuant to the provisions of this chapter.

section.heading: ï¿½Recreational vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Recreational vehicleï¿½ means a vehicular-type unit primarily designed as temporary living quarters for travel, recreational or camping use, which may be self-propelled, mounted upon, or drawn by, a motor vehicle. The term includes a recreational park trailer.

section.heading: ï¿½Registered dealerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Registered dealerï¿½ means a new vehicle dealer who is authorized to issue certificates of registration pursuant toNRS 482.216.

section.heading: ï¿½Registered ownerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Registered ownerï¿½ means a natural person, firm, corporation or association whose name appears in the files of the Department as the person to whom the vehicle is registered.

section.heading: ï¿½Replacement number plateï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Replacement number plateï¿½ means a license plate or set of license plates issued to a registered owner which bear the code of a plate or set of plates which were previously issued but expired and have remained expired for a continuous period longer than 18 months.

section.heading: ï¿½Residentï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Residentï¿½ includes, but is not limited to, a person: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Whose legal residence is in the State of Nevada. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Who engages in intrastate business and operates in such a business any motor vehicle, trailer or semitrailer, or any person maintaining such vehicles in this State, as the home state of such vehicles. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Who physically resides in this State and engages in a trade, profession, occupation or accepts gainful employment in this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Who declares that he or she is a resident of Nevada for purposes of obtaining privileges not ordinarily extended to nonresidents of this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The term does not include a person who is an actual tourist, an out-of-state student, a border state employee or a seasonal resident. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of this section do not apply to persons who operate vehicles in this State under the provisions ofNRS 482.385,482.390,482.395,482.3961or706.801to706.861, inclusive.

section.heading: ï¿½Roof assemblyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Roof assemblyï¿½ means the structural parts of a vehicle, including, without limitation, more than one-half of the vertical roof supports, the framework of the roof and the exterior metal skin, that together are designed and intended to be located over the passenger compartment to form the roof of the vehicle.

section.heading: ï¿½Salespersonï¿½ defined.

content.p: A person employed by a vehicle dealer, under any form of contract or arrangement to sell, exchange, buy, or offer for sale, or exchange an interest in a vehicle to any person, who receives or expects to receive a commission, fee or any other consideration from the seller or purchaser of the vehicle; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person who exercises managerial control within the business of a dealer or a long-term or short-term lessor, or who supervises salespersons employed by a dealer or a long-term or short-term lessor, whether compensated by salary or by commission, or who negotiates with or induces a customer to enter into a security agreement on behalf of a dealer or a long-term or short-term lessor.

section.heading: ï¿½Security interestï¿½ defined.

content.p: The inclusion of an option to purchase does not of itself make the lease one intended for security; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An agreement that upon compliance with the terms of the lease the lessee shall become or has the option to become the owner of the vehicle for no additional consideration does make the lease one intended for security.

section.heading: ï¿½Semitrailerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Semitrailerï¿½ means every vehicle of the trailer type so designed and used in conjunction with a motor vehicle that some part of its own weight and that of its own load rests upon or is carried by another vehicle.

section.heading: ï¿½Service vehicleï¿½ and ï¿½work vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Service vehicleï¿½ or ï¿½work vehicleï¿½ means a vehicle owned and operated by a licensed dealer, manufacturer, distributor, long-term or short-term lessor, rebuilder or broker in the furtherance of his or her business. Such vehicles include, without limitation, a passenger shuttle bus, a tow car, a delivery vehicle or any other vehicle used to transport customers or property to or from the place of business of the dealer, manufacturer, distributor, long-term or short-term lessor, rebuilder or broker.

section.heading: ï¿½Slide-in camperï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Slide-in camperï¿½ means a portable unit designed to be loaded and unloaded from the bed of a pickup truck, and so constructed as to provide temporary living quarters for travel, camping or recreational use.

section.heading: ï¿½Solid rubber tiresï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Solid rubber tiresï¿½ means every tire made of rubber other than a pneumatic tire.

section.heading: ï¿½Specially constructed vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Specially constructed vehicleï¿½ means any vehicle which shall not have been originally constructed under a distinctive name, make, model or type by a generally recognized manufacturer of vehicles.

section.heading: ï¿½Special mobile equipmentï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Special mobile equipmentï¿½ means every motor vehicle not designed or used primarily for the transportation of persons or property and only incidentally operated or moved upon a highway, including, but not limited to, scoopmobiles, forklifts, ditch-digging apparatus, well-boring apparatus and road construction and maintenance machinery such as asphalt graders, bituminous mixers, bucket loaders, tractors other than truck tractors, leveling graders, finishing machines, motor graders, road rollers, scarifiers, earth-moving carryalls and scrapers, power shovels and draglines, and earth-moving equipment. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Special mobile equipmentï¿½ does not include house trailers, dump trucks, truck-mounted transit mixers, concrete pumpers, cranes or drill rigs with highway-rated tires or other vehicles designed for the transportation of persons or property to which machinery has been attached. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Director may make the final determination as to whether a vehicle not specifically enumerated in subsection 1 or 2 falls within this definition. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department shall, by regulation, define ï¿½incidentally operated or moved upon a highwayï¿½ for purposes of this section.

section.heading: ï¿½Substitute number plateï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Substitute number plateï¿½ means a license plate or a set of license plates issued in place of a previously issued and unexpired plate or set of plates. The plate or set of plates does not repeat the code of the previously issued plate or set.

section.heading: ï¿½Trailerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Trailerï¿½ means every vehicle without motive power designed to carry property or passengers wholly on its own structure and to be drawn by a motor vehicle.

section.heading: ï¿½Travel trailerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Travel trailerï¿½ means a portable structure mounted on wheels, constructed on a vehicular-type chassis primarily designed as temporary living quarters for recreational, camping or travel use and designed to be drawn by another vehicle and designated by the manufacturer as a travel trailer. A vehicle is not a travel trailer if, when equipped for highway use, it is more than 8 feet wide.

section.heading: ï¿½Trimobileï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Trimobileï¿½ means every motor vehicle equipped with handlebars and a saddle seat and designed to travel with three wheels in contact with the ground, at least one of which is power driven. The term does not include a motorcycle with a sidecar.

section.heading: ï¿½Truck cab assemblyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Truck cab assemblyï¿½ means a removable portion of a truck that uses a conventional frame assembly consisting of a cab that may be bolted and unbolted which includes a floor assembly, cowl assembly, roof assembly and rear panel and may also include front, side or rear glass and front or rear left or right doors.

section.heading: ï¿½Truck-tractorï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Truck-tractorï¿½ means every motor vehicle designed and used primarily for drawing other vehicles and not so constructed as to carry a load other than a part of the weight of the vehicle and load so drawn.

section.heading: ï¿½Used vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: Has been registered with the Department or with the appropriate agency of authority of any other state, the District of Columbia, any territory or possession of the United States or foreign state, province or country and, if equipped with an odometer, registers more than 2,500 miles on the odometer; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Regardless of mileage, is at least 1 model year old, as determined by the vehicle manufacturer, and has been registered with the Department or with the appropriate agency of authority of any other state, the District of Columbia, any territory or possession of the United States or foreign state, province or country for 30 days or more, if no exemptions for registration exist under the laws of this State or the laws of the jurisdiction in which the vehicle was registered.

section.heading: ï¿½Used vehicle dealerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Used vehicle dealerï¿½ means any vehicle dealer who is licensed in accordance with the provisions of this chapter as a used vehicle dealer and who acquires used vehicles for resale.

section.heading: ï¿½Utility trailerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Utility trailerï¿½ means a vehicle, without motive power, designed to carry property or passengers wholly on its own structure, and to be drawn by a motor vehicle. It may not exceed 8 feet in width nor 3,500 pounds in weight.

section.heading: ï¿½Van conversionï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Van conversionï¿½ means a vehicular-type unit originally designed and manufactured as a van or enclosed truck, which is modified to be used for travel, camping or recreational use, but which retains the basic silhouette of a van.

section.heading: ï¿½Vehicleï¿½ defined.

content.p: Electric bicycles; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Electric scooters; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A mobile carrying device as that term is defined inNRS 484B.029; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A personal delivery device as that term is defined inNRS 484B.044.

section.heading: ï¿½Vehicle transporterï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Vehicle transporterï¿½ means a person who engages in the business of transporting motor vehicles in which he or she has no ownership interest and which are otherwise required to be registered pursuant to this chapter by operating them, singly or in combination, upon the highway under their own motive power.

section.heading: Enforcement of provisions of chapter by Department, its officers and peace officers.

content.p: The Department, all officers thereof and all peace officers in this State shall enforce the provisions of this chapter.

section.heading: Administrative regulations; establishment of branch offices; appointment of agents; compensation of certain agents; prohibition and exception on use of name, service mark, trademark or logo of Department in advertisement.

content.p: The Director may adopt and enforce such administrative regulations as are necessary to carry out the provisions of this chapter. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Director may establish branch offices as provided inNRS 481.055, and may by contract appoint any person or public agency as an agent to assist in carrying out the duties of the Department pursuant to this chapter. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the contract with each agent appointed by the Department in connection with the registration of motor vehicles and issuance of license plates may provide for compensation based upon the reasonable value of the services of the agent but must not exceed $2 for each registration. An authorized inspection station or authorized station that issues certificates of registration pursuant toNRS 482.281is not entitled to receive compensation from the Department pursuant to this subsection. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Except as otherwise provided in this section, no person may use in an advertisement: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The name, service marks, trademarks or logo of the Department; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A service mark, trademark or logo designed to closely resemble a service mark, trademark or logo of the Department and intended to mislead a viewer to believe that the service mark, trademark or logo is the service mark, trademark or logo of the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An agent appointed pursuant to subsection 2 orNRS 487.815may use the name, service marks, trademarks or logo of the Department in an advertisement if the agent has obtained the written permission of the Department for such use. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A document preparation service registered pursuant tochapter 240Aof NRS may use the term ï¿½Department of Motor Vehiclesï¿½ or ï¿½DMVï¿½ in an advertisement if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The term is immediately followed by the term ï¿½servicesï¿½ or ï¿½registration servicesï¿½ or other similar language which clearly indicates that the document preparation service is a third-party business and that the advertisement is not an advertisement of the Department; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The advertisement includes a clear and conspicuous statement that the document preparation service is a third-party business not affiliated with the Department. The statement must be of a conspicuous size, if in writing, and must appear in substantially the following form: THIS DOCUMENT PREPARATION SERVICE IS A THIRD-PARTY BUSINESS NOT AFFILIATED WITH THE NEVADA DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES.

section.heading: Department to adopt regulations setting forth criteria for determination of whether person is farmer or rancher; presentation of evidence to Department.

content.p: The Department shall adopt regulations establishing the criteria to be used to determine whether a person is a farmer or rancher for the purposes ofNRS 482.036and706.071. A person must present appropriate evidence to allow the Department to make the determination that the person satisfies the criteria set forth in the regulations.

section.heading: Department to develop and implement process for determining whether criminal history will disqualify person from obtaining a license pursuant to chapter; fee; quarterly reports.

content.p: The Department shall develop and implement a process by which a person with a criminal history may petition the Department to review the criminal history of the person to determine if the personï¿½s criminal history will disqualify the person from obtaining a license pursuant to this chapter. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Not later than 90 days after a petition is submitted to the Department pursuant to subsection 1, the Department shall inform the person of the determination of the Department of whether the personï¿½s criminal history will disqualify the person from obtaining a license. The Department is not bound by its determination of disqualification or qualification and may rescind such a determination at any time. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department may provide instructions to a person who receives a determination of disqualification to remedy the determination of disqualification. A person may resubmit a petition pursuant to subsection 1 not earlier than 6 months after receiving instructions pursuant to this subsection if the person remedies the determination of disqualification. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person with a criminal history may petition the Department at any time, including, without limitation, before obtaining any education or paying any fee required to obtain a license from the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person may submit a new petition to the Department not earlier than 2 years after the final determination of the initial petition submitted to the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department may impose a fee of up to $50 upon the person to fund the administrative costs in complying with the provisions of this section. The Department may waive such fees or allow such fees to be covered by funds from a scholarship or grant. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department may post on its Internet website: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The requirements to obtain a license from the Department; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A list of crimes, if any, that would disqualify a person from obtaining a license from the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department may request the criminal history record of a person who petitions the Department for a determination pursuant to subsection 1. To the extent consistent with federal law, if the Department makes such a request of a person, the Department shall require the person to submit his or her criminal history record which includes a report from: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Central Repository for Nevada Records of Criminal History; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Federal Bureau of Investigation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person who petitions the Department for a determination pursuant to subsection 1 shall not submit false or misleading information to the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department shall, on or before the 20th day of January, April, July and October, submit to the Director of the Legislative Counsel Bureau in an electronic format prescribed by the Director, a report that includes: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The reasons for such determinations; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other information that is requested by the Director or which the Department determines would be helpful. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Director shall transmit a compilation of the information received pursuant to subsection 10 to the Legislative Commission quarterly, unless otherwise directed by the Commission.

section.heading: Director to provide forms.

content.p: The Director shall provide suitable forms for applications, registration cards, license number plates, and all other forms requisite for the purposes of this chapter, and shall prepay all transportation charges thereon.

section.heading: Department prohibited from requiring person to disclose communication need. [Effective through December 31, 2025.]

content.p: The Department shall not require any person to disclose that the person is a person with a communication need. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½a person with a communication needï¿½ means a person who: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is deaf, as defined inNRS 426.084; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Has a speech disorder that impairs the ability of the person to articulate speech sounds, speak fluently or use the personï¿½s voice; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is neurodivergent; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Has any other condition that impairs the ability of the person to comprehend language.

section.heading: Records of Department concerning registration and licensing.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided inNRS 239.0115,481.063,483.651,483.655,483.657and485.316, all personal information in the records of registration and licensing in the offices of the Department is confidential and must not knowingly be disclosed by the Department.

section.heading: List of registered owners to be provided for selection of jury; reimbursement of Department.

content.p: The Department shall provide a list of registered owners of motor vehicles in any county upon the request of a district judge or jury commissioner of the judicial district in which the county lies for use by the district judge or jury commissioner for purposes of jury selection. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The court or jury commissioner who requests the list shall reimburse the Department for the reasonable cost of the list.

section.heading: Validity of registration: Powers and duties of Department and registered dealers.

content.p: The Department and the officers and deputies thereof and registered dealers shall examine, and to the best of their ability determine the genuineness and regularity of, every registration and transfer of registration of a vehicle as provided in this chapter, in order that every certificate issued for a vehicle must contain true statements of the ownership thereof, and to prevent the registration of a vehicle by any person not entitled thereto. The Department or a registered dealer may require any applicant to furnish such information in addition to that contained in the application as may be necessary to satisfy the Department of the truth and regularity of the application.

The Motor Vehicle Fund is hereby created as an agency fund. Except as otherwise provided in subsection 4 or by a specific statute, all money received or collected by the Department must be deposited in the State Treasury for credit to the Motor Vehicle Fund. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The interest and income on the money in the Motor Vehicle Fund, after deducting any applicable charges, must be credited to the State Highway Fund. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any check accepted by the Department in payment of the governmental services tax or any other fee required to be collected pursuant to this chapter must, if it is dishonored upon presentation for payment, be charged back against the Motor Vehicle Fund or the county to which the payment was credited pursuant to this section orNRS 482.181, in the proper proportion. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in subsection 6, all money received or collected by the Department for the basic governmental services tax must be distributed in the manner set forth inNRS 482.181and482.182. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Money for the administration of the provisions of this chapter must be provided by direct legislative appropriation from the State Highway Fund or other legislative authorization, upon the presentation of budgets in the manner required by law. Out of the appropriation or authorization, the Department shall pay every item of expense. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department shall withhold 6 percent from the amount of the governmental services tax collected by the Department as a commission. From the amount of the governmental services tax collected by a county assessor, the State Controller shall credit 1 percent to the Department as a commission and remit 5 percent to the county for credit to its general fund as commission for the services of the county assessor. All money withheld by or credited to the Department pursuant to this subsection must be used only for the administration of this chapter as authorized by the Legislature pursuant to subsection 5. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

When the requirements of this section andNRS 482.181and482.182have been met, and when directed by the Department, the State Controller shall transfer monthly to the State Highway Fund any balance in the Motor Vehicle Fund. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If a statute requires that any money in the Motor Vehicle Fund be transferred to another fund or account, the Department shall direct the State Controller to transfer the money in accordance with the statute.

section.heading: Revolving Account for Issuance of Special License Plates: Creation; deposit of certain fees; use of money in Account; transfer of excess balance to State Highway Fund; exception.

content.p: The Revolving Account for the Issuance of Special License Plates is hereby created as a special account in the State Highway Fund. An amount equal to $35 of the fee received by the Department for the initial issuance of a special license plate, not including any additional fee which may be added to generate financial support for a particular cause or charitable organization, must be deposited in the State Highway Fund for credit to the Account. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department shall use the money in the Account to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Pay the expenses involved in issuing special license plates; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Purchase improved and upgraded technology, including, without limitation, digital technology for the production of special license plates, to ensure that special license plates are produced in the most efficient manner possible. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Money in the Account must be used only for the purposes specified in subsection 2. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

At the end of each fiscal year, the State Controller shall transfer from the Account to the State Highway Fund an amount of money equal to the balance in the Account which exceeds $50,000. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of this section do not apply toNRS 482.37901.

section.heading: Governmental services taxes: Certification of amount collected each month; distribution.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 5, after deducting the amount withheld by the Department and the amount credited to the Department pursuant to subsection 6 ofNRS 482.180, and the amount transferred to the State Highway Fund pursuant toNRS 482.182, the Department shall certify monthly to the State Board of Examiners the amount of the basic and supplemental governmental services taxes collected for each county by the Department and its agents during the preceding month, and that money must be distributed monthly as provided in this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any supplemental governmental services tax collected for a county must be distributed only to the county, to be used as provided inNRS 371.043,371.045and371.047. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The distribution of the basic governmental services tax received or collected for each county must be made to the State Education Fund or the fund for capital projects or debt service fund of a county school district, as applicable, before any distribution is made to a local government, special district or enterprise district. For the purpose of calculating the amount of the basic governmental services tax to be distributed to the State Education Fund or the fund for capital projects or debt service fund of a county school district, as applicable, the taxes levied by each local government, special district and enterprise district are the product of its certified valuation, determined pursuant to subsection 2 ofNRS 361.405, and its tax rate, established pursuant toNRS 361.455for the fiscal year beginning on July 1, 1980, except that the tax rate for school districts, including the rate attributable to a districtï¿½s debt service, is the rate established pursuant toNRS 361.455for the fiscal year beginning on July 1, 1978, but if the rate attributable to a districtï¿½s debt service in any fiscal year is greater than its rate for the fiscal year beginning on July 1, 1978, the higher rate must be used to determine the amount attributable to debt service. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

After making the distributions set forth in subsection 3, the remaining money received or collected for each county must be deposited in the Local Government Tax Distribution Account created byNRS 360.660for distribution to local governments, special districts and enterprise districts within each county pursuant to the provisions ofNRS 360.680and360.690. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An amount equal to any basic governmental services tax distributed to a redevelopment agency in the Fiscal Year 1987-1988 must continue to be distributed to that agency as long as it exists but must not be increased. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department shall make distributions of the basic governmental services tax directly to the State Education Fund or the fund for capital projects or debt service fund of a county school district, as applicable. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Enterprise districtï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 360.620. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Local governmentï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 360.640. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Received or collected for each countyï¿½ means: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For the basic governmental services tax collected on vehicles subject to the provisions ofchapter 706of NRS, the amount determined for each county based on the following percentages: Carson City................... 1.07 percentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Lincoln................... 3.12 percent Churchill....................... 5.21 percentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Lyon....................... 2.90 percent Clark............................ 22.54 percentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Mineral................... 2.40 percent Douglas......................... 2.52 percentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Nye......................... 4.09 percent Elko.............................. 13.31 percentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Pershing................. 7.00 percent Esmeralda..................... 2.52 percentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Storey..................... 0.19 percent Eureka........................... 3.10 percentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ Washoe................ 12.24 percent Humboldt...................... 8.25 percentï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ White Pine............. 5.66 percent Lander........................... 3.88 percent ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For all other basic and supplemental governmental services tax received or collected by the Department, the amount attributable to each county based on the county of registration of the vehicle for which the tax was paid. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Special districtï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 360.650.

section.heading: Governmental services taxes: Transfer of certain amount from proceeds to State Highway Fund.

content.p: After deducting the amount withheld by the Department and the amount credited to the Department pursuant to subsection 6 ofNRS 482.180and before carrying out the provisions ofNRS 482.181each month, the Department shall direct the State Controller to transfer to the State Highway Fund from the proceeds of the basic governmental services tax collected by the Department and its agents during the preceding month, the amounts indicated pursuant to this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in subsection 3, the amount required to be transferred pursuant to subsection 1 from the proceeds of the basic governmental services tax imposed on vehicles depreciated in accordance with: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Subsection 1 ofNRS 371.060based upon an age of: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Eight years, is a sum equal to 40 percent of those proceeds; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Nine years or more, is a sum equal to 67 percent of those proceeds; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Subsection 2 ofNRS 371.060based upon an age of: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Nine years, is a sum equal to 40 percent of those proceeds; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Ten years or more, is a sum equal to 43 percent of those proceeds. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The amount required to be transferred pursuant to subsection 1 from the proceeds of the basic governmental services tax imposed on vehicles to which the minimum amount of that tax applies pursuant to paragraph
of subsection 3 ofNRS 371.060is a sum equal to 63 percent of those proceeds.

Except as otherwise provided in subsection 3, any voluntary contributions collected pursuant to subsection 12 ofNRS 482.480must be distributed to each county based on the county of registration of the vehicle for which the contribution was made, to be used as provided inNRS 244.2643,277A.285or403.575, as applicable. The Department shall remit monthly the contributions directly: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In a county in which a regional transportation commission exists, to the regional transportation commission. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In a county whose population is 100,000 or more and in which a regional transportation commission does not exist, to the board of county commissioners. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

In a county whose population is less than 100,000 and in which a regional transportation commission does not exist, to the board of county highway commissioners created pursuant toNRS 403.010. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department shall certify monthly to the State Board of Examiners the amount of the voluntary contributions collected pursuant to subsection 12 ofNRS 482.480for each county by the Department and its agents during the preceding month, and that the money has been distributed as provided in this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department shall deduct and withhold 1 percent of the contributions collected pursuant to subsection 1 to reimburse the Department for its expenses in collecting and distributing the contributions. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½regional transportation commissionï¿½ means a regional transportation commission created and organized in accordance withchapter 277Aof NRS.

section.heading: Motor Vehicle Revolving Account: Creation; use; deposits.

content.p: The Motor Vehicle Revolving Account is hereby created and must be used for making change in the main and branch offices of the Department. The State Board of Examiners shall determine the amount of money to be deposited in the Account, within the limits of money available for that purpose.

section.heading: Certain odometers deemed to register actual miles traveled by vehicle.

content.p: For the purposes of this chapter, if an odometer that is connected to a motor vehicle is not capable of registering 100,000 miles or more, the odometer shall be deemed to register the actual mileage the vehicle has traveled while in operation.

section.heading: Department authorized to enter into written agreements for periodic payment of delinquent taxes or fees; regulations.

content.p: Enter into written agreements providing for the periodic payment of delinquent taxes or fees imposed pursuant to this chapter. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Adopt regulations: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Setting forth the permissible terms of those agreements; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Providing for the cancellation of such an agreement if the person with whom the Department has contracted becomes delinquent in his or her payments pursuant to the agreement or in payment of other taxes or fees owed to the Department pursuant to the provisions ofchapter 365,366,371,373or482of NRS.

section.heading: Waiver of penalty or interest for failure timely to file return or pay tax, penalty or fee in certain circumstances.

content.p: The Department may waive payment of a penalty or interest for a personï¿½s failure timely to file a return or pay a tax, penalty or fee imposed by the Department pursuant to this chapter or any other provision of law, if the Department determines that the failure: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Occurred despite the personï¿½s exercise of ordinary care; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Was not a result of the personï¿½s willful neglect. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person requesting relief from payment of a penalty or interest must file with the Department a sworn statement specifying the facts supporting the personï¿½s claim for relief.

section.heading: Registration required for certain vehicles.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in this chapter andNRS 706.188, every owner of a motor vehicle, trailer or semitrailer intended to be operated upon any highway in this State shall, before the motor vehicle, trailer or semitrailer can be operated, apply to the Department or a registered dealer for and obtain the registration thereof.

section.heading: Periods of registration for vehicles; exceptions.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in this section andNRS 482.2065and482.2085, every motor vehicle, except for a motor vehicle that is required to be registered through the Motor Carrier Division of the Department, and except for a full trailer or semitrailer that is registered pursuant to subsection 3 ofNRS 482.483or a moped registered pursuant toNRS 482.2155, must be registered for a period of 12 consecutive months beginning the day after the first registration by the owner in this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in subsections 7 and 8 andNRS 482.2065, every vehicle registered by an agent of the Department or a registered dealer must be registered for 12 consecutive months beginning the first day of the month after the first registration by the owner in this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in subsection 7 andNRS 482.2065and482.2085, a motor vehicle which must be registered through the Motor Carrier Division of the Department, including, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Pursuant to the provisions ofNRS 706.801to706.861, inclusive; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

As a commercial motor vehicle which has a declared gross weight in excess of 10,000 pounds, ï¿½must be registered for a period of 12 consecutive months beginning on the date established by the Department by regulation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon the application of the owner of a fleet of vehicles which are not required to be registered through the Motor Carrier Division of the Department, the Director may permit the owner to register the fleet on the basis of a calendar year. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in subsections 3, 6, 7 and 8, when the registration of any vehicle is transferred pursuant toNRS 482.399, the expiration date of each regular license plate, special license plate or substitute decal must, at the time of the transfer of registration, be advanced for a period of 12 consecutive months beginning: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The first day of the month after the transfer, if the vehicle is transferred by an agent of the Department; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The day after the transfer in all other cases, ï¿½and a credit on the portion of the fee for registration and the governmental services tax attributable to the remainder of the current period of registration must be allowed pursuant to the applicable provisions ofNRS 482.399. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

When the registration of any trailer that is registered for a 3-year period pursuant toNRS 482.2065is transferred pursuant toNRS 482.399, the expiration date of each license plate or substitute decal must, at the time of the transfer of the registration, be advanced, if applicable pursuant toNRS 482.2065, for a period of 3 consecutive years beginning: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The first day of the month after the transfer, if the trailer is transferred by an agent of the Department; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The day after the transfer in all other cases, ï¿½and a credit on the portion of the fee for registration and the governmental services tax attributable to the remainder of the current period of registration must be allowed pursuant to the applicable provisions ofNRS 482.399. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A full trailer or semitrailer that is registered pursuant to subsection 3 ofNRS 482.483is registered until the date on which the owner of the full trailer or semitrailer: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Transfers the ownership of the full trailer or semitrailer; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Cancels the registration of the full trailer or semitrailer and surrenders the license plates to the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A moped that is registered pursuant toNRS 482.2155is registered until the date on which the owner of the moped: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Transfers the ownership of the moped; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Cancels the registration of the moped and surrenders the license plate to the Department.

section.heading: Alternate 3-year period of registration for trailers; imposition of governmental services tax; fees.

content.p: A trailer may be registered for a 3-year period as provided in this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A person who registers a trailer for a 3-year period must pay upon registration all fees and taxes that would be due during the 3-year period if he or she registered the trailer for 1 year and renewed that registration for 2 consecutive years immediately thereafter, including, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Registration fees pursuant toNRS 482.480and482.483. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A fee for each license plate issued pursuant toNRS 482.268. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Fees for the initial issuance and renewal of a special license plate pursuant toNRS 482.265, if applicable. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Fees for the initial issuance and renewal of a personalized prestige license plate pursuant toNRS 482.367, if applicable. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Additional fees for the initial issuance and renewal of a special license plate issued pursuant toNRS 482.3667to482.3823, inclusive, which are imposed to generate financial support for a particular cause or charitable organization, if applicable. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Governmental services taxes imposed pursuant tochapter 371of NRS, as provided inNRS 482.260. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The applicable taxes imposed pursuant tochapters 372,374,377and377Aof NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, the term ï¿½trailerï¿½ does not include a full trailer or semitrailer that is registered pursuant to subsection 3 ofNRS 482.483.

section.heading: Registration of leased vehicles by long-term lessor or long-term lessee.

content.p: Any vehicle which is leased by a long-term lessor to a long-term lessee having a place of business or residence in this State, for use on the public highways of this State, is subject to registration in this State either by the long-term lessor or the long-term lessee.

section.heading: Registration program for short-term lessors: Establishment by Department; eligibility; decal to indicate registration status of vehicle; Department to provide electronic notice of renewal; duties of short-term lessor; regulations.

content.p: The Department shall establish a vehicle registration program for short-term lessors that have a fleet of vehicles registered in this State to allow the short-term lessors which satisfy the requirements for eligibility established by the Department to submit to the Department: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Applications for initial registration of vehicles added to the fleet, which must include, without limitation, the information required byNRS 482.295. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Applications for the renewal of the registration of vehicles in the fleet, including, without limitation, the information required byNRS 482.295. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Payment of the registration fees and governmental services taxes due for the initial registration and renewal of vehicles in the fleet, including, without limitation, any sales or use tax due pursuant toNRS 482.225. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department shall issue for each vehicle in the fleet of a short-term lessor that is registered pursuant to this section a: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Certificate of registration; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Decal indicating the registration status of the vehicle pursuant to the program, which must be affixed to the license plate of each vehicle. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A certificate of registration and decal issued pursuant to this section are valid for the vehicle until the vehicle is no longer a part of the fleet of the short-term lessor, unless the short-term lessor fails to renew the registration. The short-term lessor must not be required to display on the license plate of a vehicle registered pursuant to this section the month and year on which the registration expires. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department shall provide to a short-term lessor that participates in the program established pursuant to subsection 1 electronic notice of the required renewal of registration for a vehicle in the fleet, which must be sent at least 30 days before payment is due. Notification sent pursuant to this subsection must include the information required pursuant to subsection 3 ofNRS 482.280for other renewals. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A short-term lessor that participates in the program established pursuant to subsection 1 must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Pay annually the renewal fees and governmental services taxes required for each fleet vehicle registered in this State. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Upon removing a vehicle from the fleet, notify the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any vehicle having a declared gross weight in excess of 26,000 pounds is not eligible to be registered as part of a fleet pursuant to this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department shall adopt regulations necessary to carry out the provisions of this section. The regulations must include, without limitation, the number of vehicles that a short-term lessor must possess as part of the fleet to participate in the program.

section.heading: Department prohibited from charging additional fee for delinquent or late registration of vehicle owned by deployed member of military; affidavit required.

content.p: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Department shall not impose an additional fee against the owner of a vehicle for the delinquent or late registration of that vehicle if the owner was a member of the military deployed to a combat or combat supporting position at the time of the expiration of the prior registration. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Evidence that the owner of a vehicle was a member of the military deployed to a combat or combat supporting position at a particular time must be furnished by an affidavit executed by a person having knowledge of the fact. The affidavit must accompany the application for renewal of registration. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Additional feeï¿½ means any fine, fee, assessment or other monetary penalty that the Department imposes or collects solely because a vehicle is registered after the date by which it is ordinarily required to be registered. The term does not include a fee or tax that would be due and payable irrespective of the registration of a vehicle being late. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Militaryï¿½ means the Armed Forces of the United States, a reserve component thereof or the National Guard.

section.heading: Exemptions from registration.

content.p: The provisions of this chapter requiring the registration of certain vehicles do not apply to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Special mobile equipment. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Implements of husbandry. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any mobile home or commercial coach subject to the provisions ofchapter 489of NRS. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Electric bicycles. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Golf carts which are: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Traveling upon highways properly designated by the appropriate city or county as permissible for the operation of golf carts; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Operating pursuant to a permit issued pursuant to this chapter. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Towable tools or equipment as defined inNRS 484D.055. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any motorized conveyance for a wheelchair, whose operator is a person with a disability who is unable to walk about. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Electric scooters. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For the purposes of this section, ï¿½motorized conveyance for a wheelchairï¿½ means a vehicle which: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Can carry a wheelchair; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Is propelled by an engine which produces not more than 3 gross brake horsepower, has a displacement of not more than 50 cubic centimeters or produces not more than 2250 watts final output; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is designed to travel on not more than three wheels; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Can reach a speed of not more than 30 miles per hour on a flat surface with not more than a grade of 1 percent in any direction. ï¿½The term does not include a tractor.

section.heading: Application for registration. [Effective through December 31, 2026.]

content.p: Except as otherwise provided inNRS 482.2085and482.2155, all applications for registration, except applications for renewal of registration, must be made as provided in this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided inNRS 482.294, applications for all registrations, except renewals of registration, must be made in person, if practicable, to any office or agent of the Department or to a registered dealer. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Each application must be made upon the appropriate form furnished by the Department and contain: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The signature of the owner, except as otherwise provided in subsection 2 ofNRS 482.294, if applicable. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The ownerï¿½s residential address. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The ownerï¿½s declaration of the county where he or she intends the vehicle to be based, unless the vehicle is deemed to have no base. The Department shall use this declaration to determine the county to which the governmental services tax is to be paid. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If required pursuant toNRS 482.2177, the mileage shown on the odometer of the vehicle at the time of application and any other information required by the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A brief description of the vehicle to be registered, including the name of the maker, the engine, identification or serial number, whether new or used, and the last license number, if known, and the state in which it was issued, and upon the registration of a new vehicle, the date of sale by the manufacturer or franchised and licensed dealer in this State for the make to be registered to the person first purchasing or operating the vehicle. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph, if the applicant is not an owner of a fleet of vehicles or a person described in subsection 5: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Proof satisfactory to the Department or registered dealer that the applicant carries insurance on the vehicle provided by an insurance company licensed by the Division of Insurance of the Department of Business and Industry and approved to do business in this State as required byNRS 485.185; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A declaration signed by the applicant that he or she will maintain the insurance required byNRS 485.185during the period of registration. If the application is submitted by electronic means pursuant toNRS 482.294, the applicant is not required to sign the declaration required by this subparagraph. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the applicant is an owner of a fleet of vehicles or a person described in subsection 5, evidence of insurance provided by an insurance company licensed by the Division of Insurance of the Department of Business and Industry and approved to do business in this State as required byNRS 485.185: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In the form of a card issued pursuant toNRS 690B.023which identifies the vehicle or the registered owner of the vehicle; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

In another form satisfactory to the Department, including, without limitation, an electronic format authorized byNRS 690B.023. ï¿½The Department may file that evidence, return it to the applicant or otherwise dispose of it. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If required, evidence of the applicantï¿½s compliance with controls over emission. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the application for registration is submitted via the Internet, a statement which informs the applicant that he or she may make a nonrefundable monetary contribution of $2 for each vehicle registered for the Complete Streets Program, if any, created pursuant toNRS 244.2643,277A.285or403.575, as applicable, based on the declaration made pursuant to paragraph

. The application form must state in a clear and conspicuous manner that a contribution for a Complete Streets Program is nonrefundable and voluntary and is in addition to any fees required for registration, and must include a method by which the applicant must indicate his or her intention to opt in or opt out of making such a contribution. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The application must contain such other information as is required by the Department or registered dealer and must be accompanied by proof of ownership satisfactory to the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For purposes of the evidence required by paragraph
of subsection 3: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Vehicles which are subject to the fee for a license and the requirements of registration of the Interstate Highway User Fee Apportionment Act, and which are based in this State, may be declared as a fleet by the registered owner thereof on his or her original application for or application for renewal of a proportional registration. The owner may file a single certificate of insurance covering that fleet. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Other fleets composed of 10 or more vehicles based in this State or vehicles insured under a blanket policy which does not identify individual vehicles may each be declared annually as a fleet by the registered owner thereof for the purposes of an application for his or her original or any renewed registration. The owner may file a single certificate of insurance covering that fleet. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person who qualifies as a self-insurer pursuant to the provisions ofNRS 485.380may file a copy of his or her certificate of self-insurance. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person who qualifies for an operatorï¿½s policy of liability insurance pursuant to the provisions ofNRS 485.186and485.3091may file or provide electronic evidence of that insurance.

section.heading: Registration of moped: Application; inspection; fees; Department to issue license plate; registration not renewable or transferable.

content.p: The owner of a moped shall, before the moped may be operated upon any highway in this State, apply to the Department for and obtain registration thereof. The application must be made upon the appropriate form as prescribed by the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An application for the registration of a moped pursuant to this section must include: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The signature and residential address of the owner of the moped. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The ownerï¿½s declaration of the county where he or she intends the moped to be based, unless the moped is deemed to have no base. The Department shall use this declaration to determine the county to which the governmental services tax is to be paid. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
