Except as otherwise provided in subsections 5, 6 and 7, the transferee shall immediately apply for registration as provided inNRS 482.215and shall pay the governmental services taxes due. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the transferee is a dealer who intends to resell the vehicle, the transferee is not required to register, pay a transfer or registration fee for, or pay a governmental services tax on the vehicle. When the vehicle is resold, the purchaser shall apply for registration as provided inNRS 482.215and shall pay the governmental services taxes due. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the transferee consigns the vehicle to a wholesale vehicle auctioneer: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The transferee shall, within 30 days after that consignment, provide the wholesale vehicle auctioneer with the certificate of title for the vehicle, executed as required by subsection 1, and any other documents necessary to obtain another certificate of title for the vehicle. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The wholesale vehicle auctioneer shall be deemed a transferee of the vehicle for the purposes of subsection 5. The wholesale vehicle auctioneer is not required to comply with subsection 1 if the wholesale vehicle auctioneer: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Auctions the vehicle to a vehicle dealer or automobile wrecker who is licensed as such in this or any other state; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Stamps his or her name, his or her identification number as a vehicle dealer and the date of the auction on the certificate of title and the bill of sale and any other documents of transfer for the vehicle. The wholesale vehicle auctioneer may stamp electronically the information which is required to be stamped on any document pursuant to this subparagraph. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A charitable organization which intends to sell a vehicle which has been donated to the organization must deliver immediately to the Department or its agent the certificate of registration and the license plate or plates for the vehicle, if the license plate or plates have not been removed from the vehicle. The charitable organization must not be required to register, pay a transfer or registration fee for, or pay a governmental services tax on the vehicle. When the vehicle is sold by the charitable organization, the purchaser shall apply for registration as provided inNRS 482.215and pay the governmental services taxes due. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½wholesale vehicle auctioneerï¿½ means a dealer who: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is engaged in the business of auctioning consigned motor vehicles to vehicle dealers or automobile wreckers, or both, who are licensed as such in this or any other state; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Does not in the ordinary course of business buy, sell or own the vehicles he or she auctions.

section.heading: Transferee to apply for certificate of registration and pay governmental services tax.

content.p: The transferee of a vehicle shall apply for a certificate of registration and pay the governmental services tax to the deputy registrar of motor vehicles in any county of this State, in the manner provided in this chapter for an original registration.

section.heading: Registration if transferee unable to produce certificate of registration or title.

content.p: Whenever application is made to the Department for registration of a vehicle previously registered pursuant to this chapter and the applicant is unable to present the certificate of registration or certificate of title previously issued for the vehicle because the certificate of registration or certificate of title is lost, unlawfully detained by one in possession or otherwise not available, the Department may receive the application, investigate the circumstances of the case and require the filing of affidavits or other information. When the Department is satisfied that the applicant is entitled to a new certificate of registration and certificate of title, it may register the applicantï¿½s vehicle and issue new certificates and a new license plate or plates to the person or persons entitled thereto. An applicant who is unable to satisfy the Department that the applicant is entitled to a new certificate of title pursuant to this subsection may obtain a new certificate of title pursuant to the provisions ofNRS 482.2605. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Whenever application is made to the Department for the registration of a motor vehicle of which the: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Ownership has been transferred; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Certificate of title is lost, unlawfully detained by one in possession or otherwise not available; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Model year is 2011 or newer and the motor vehicle is less than 20 years old, ï¿½the transferor of the motor vehicle may, to furnish any information required by the Department to carry out the provisions ofNRS 484D.330, designate the transferee of the motor vehicle as attorney-in-fact on a form for a power of attorney provided by the Department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department shall provide the form described in subsection 2. The form must be: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Produced in a manner that ensures that the form may not be easily counterfeited; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Substantially similar to the form set forth in Appendix E of Part 580 of Title 49 of the Code of Federal Regulations. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department may charge a fee not to exceed 50 cents for each form it provides.

section.heading: Transfer other than voluntary transfer: Expiration of registration; operation of vehicle.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2, in the event of the transfer by operation of law of the title or interest of an owner in and to a vehicle as upon inheritance, devise or bequest, order in bankruptcy or insolvency, execution sale, repossession upon default in performing the terms of a lease or executory sales contract, transfer on death pursuant toNRS 482.247, or otherwise, the registration thereof expires and the vehicle must not be operated upon the highways until and unless the person entitled thereto shall apply for and obtain the registration thereof. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An administrator, executor, trustee or other representative of the owner, or a sheriff or other officer, or any person repossessing the vehicle under the terms of a conditional sales contract, lease or other security agreement, or the assignee or legal representative of any such person, may operate or cause to be operated any vehicle upon the highways for a distance not to exceed 75 miles from the place of repossession or place where formerly kept by the owner to a garage, warehouse or other place of keeping or storage, either upon displaying upon such vehicle the number plate issued to the former owner or without a number plate attached thereto but under written permission first obtained from the Department or the local police authorities having jurisdiction over such highways, and upon displaying in plain sight a placard bearing the name and address of the person authorizing and directing such movement and plainly readable from a distance of 100 feet during daylight.

section.heading: Circumstances in which lease does not constitute sale or create security interest.

content.p: Notwithstanding any specific statute to the contrary, the lease of a motor vehicle or trailer for use primarily in a trade or business of the lessee does not constitute a sale or create a security interest merely because the lease permits or requires that the rental price be adjusted upward or downward by reference to the amount realized by the lessor upon the sale or other disposition of the motor vehicle or trailer upon the termination of the lease.

section.heading: Sale of new vehicle: Duties of seller; information concerning secured party or assignee; temporary placards; dealer to complete dealerï¿½s report of sale and furnish copy of information included therein; applicability of section.

content.p: When a new vehicle is sold in this State for the first time, the seller shall complete and submit to the Department a manufacturerï¿½s certificate of origin or a manufacturerï¿½s statement of origin and, unless the vehicle is sold to a dealer who is licensed to sell the vehicle, transmit electronically to the Department a dealerï¿½s report of sale. The dealerï¿½s report of sale must be transmitted electronically to the Department in the manner required by the Department and must include: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A description of the vehicle; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The name and address of the seller; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The name and address of the buyer. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If, in connection with the sale, a security interest is taken or retained by the seller to secure all or part of the purchase price, or a security interest is taken by a person who gives value to enable the buyer to acquire rights in the vehicle, the name and address of the secured party or his or her assignee must be included in the dealerï¿½s report of sale and on the manufacturerï¿½s certificate or statement of origin. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Unless an extension of time is granted by the Department, the seller shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A certificate of title for a vehicle registered in this State; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The processing of the dealerï¿½s report of sale; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Within 20 days after the electronic transmission to the Department of the dealerï¿½s report of sale: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Submit to the Department the manufacturerï¿½s certificate or statement of origin; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Remit to the Department the fees collected pursuant to paragraph
. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon entering into a contract or other written agreement for the sale of a new vehicle, the seller shall affix a temporary placard to the rear of the vehicle. Only one temporary placard may be issued for the vehicle. The temporary placard must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be in a form prescribed by the Department; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Include the date of its expiration. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

of subsection 3, the Department shall use the date on which the dealerï¿½s report of sale was transmitted electronically to the Department as the beginning date of the 20-day period. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon execution of all the documents necessary to complete the sale of a vehicle, including, without limitation, the financial documents, the dealer shall complete the dealerï¿½s report of sale and furnish a copy of the information included therein to the buyer not less than 10 days before the expiration of the temporary placard. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

content.p: If a new vehicle is leased in this State by a long-term lessor, the long-term lessor shall complete and submit to the Department a manufacturerï¿½s certificate of origin or a manufacturerï¿½s statement of origin, and transmit electronically to the Department a long-term lessorï¿½s report of lease. content.p: When a used or rebuilt vehicle is sold in this State to any person, except a licensed dealer, by a dealer, rebuilder, long-term lessor or short-term lessor, the seller shall complete and submit to the Department a dealerï¿½s or rebuilderï¿½s report of sale. Unless an extension of time is granted by the Department, the seller shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Collect the fees set forth inNRS 482.429for: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A certificate of title for a vehicle registered in this State; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The processing of the dealerï¿½s or rebuilderï¿½s report of sale; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Within 30 days after the electronic transmission to the Department of the dealerï¿½s or rebuilderï¿½s report of sale: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Submit to the Department the properly endorsed certificate of title previously issued for the vehicle; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Remit to the Department the fees collected pursuant to paragraph
. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon entering into a contract or other written agreement for the sale of a used or rebuilt vehicle, the seller shall affix a temporary placard to the rear of the vehicle. Only one temporary placard may be issued for the vehicle. The temporary placard must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

To establish compliance with the period required by paragraph

of subsection 3, the Department shall use the date on which the dealerï¿½s or rebuilderï¿½s report of sale was transmitted electronically to the Department as the beginning date of the 30-day period. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon executing all the documents necessary to complete the sale of the vehicle, including, without limitation, the financial documents, the seller shall complete the dealerï¿½s or rebuilderï¿½s report of sale and furnish a copy of the information included therein to the buyer not less than 10 days before the expiration of the temporary placard.

content.p: If a used or rebuilt vehicle is leased in this State by a long-term lessor, the long-term lessor shall complete and submit to the Department a long-term lessorï¿½s report of lease. A description of the vehicle; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An indication as to whether the vehicle is a rebuilt vehicle; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The names and addresses of the long-term lessor, long-term lessee and any person having a security interest in the vehicle. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Unless an extension of time is granted by the Department, the long-term lessor shall, within 30 days after the electronic transmission to the Department of the long-term lessorï¿½s report of lease: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Submit to the Department the properly endorsed certificate of title previously issued for the vehicle; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Collect and remit to the Department the fee set forth inNRS 482.429for the processing of the long-term lessorï¿½s report of lease. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon entering into a lease or written agreement to lease for a used or rebuilt vehicle, the long-term lessor shall affix a temporary placard to the rear of the vehicle. Only one temporary placard may be issued for the vehicle. The temporary placard must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be in a form prescribed by the Department; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be free from foreign materials and clearly visible from the rear of the vehicle; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Compliance with the requirements of subsection 3 permits the vehicle to be operated for a period not to exceed 30 days after the execution of a written agreement to lease or the lease, whichever comes first. Upon issuance of the certificate of registration and license plates for the vehicle or the expiration of the temporary placard, whichever occurs first, the long-term lessee shall remove the temporary placard from the rear of the vehicle. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

section.heading: Issuance of certificate of title to buyer, secured party or assignee.

content.p: Upon receipt of the documents required respectively byNRS 482.423,482.424and482.426to be submitted to it, and the payment of all required fees, the Department shall issue a certificate of title. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If no security interest is created or exists in connection with the sale, the certificate of title must be issued to the buyer. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If a security interest is created by the sale, the certificate of title must be issued to the secured party or to his or her assignee.

section.heading: Issuance of certificates of title to certain secured parties.

content.p: Whenever a security interest is created in a motor vehicle, other than a security interest required to be entered pursuant toNRS 482.423,482.424or482.426, the certificate of title of the vehicle must be delivered to the Department with a statement signed by the debtor showing the date of the security agreement, the name and address of the debtor and the name and address of the secured party. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Department shall issue and deliver to the secured party a certificate of title with the name and address of the secured party noted thereon.

section.heading: Electronic lien system for notification and release of security interests: Duties of Department; qualifications and requirements of contractor; participation of lienholders; electronic lien admissible as evidence of existence of lien; regulations.

content.p: The Department shall enter into one or more contracts pursuant to this section to establish, implement and operate, in lieu of the issuance and maintenance of paper documents otherwise required by this chapter, an electronic lien system to process the notification and release of security interests through electronic batch file transfers. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any contract entered into pursuant to this section must not require the Department to pay any amount to a contractor unless otherwise provided in this section. A contractor must be required to reimburse the Department for any reasonable implementation costs directly incurred by the Department during the establishment and ongoing administration of the electronic lien system. A contract entered into pursuant to this section must include provisions specifically prohibiting a contractor from using information concerning vehicle titles for marketing or solicitation purposes. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The electronic lien system must allow qualified service providers to participate in the system. A lienholder may participate in the system through any qualified service provider approved by the Department for participation in the system. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Service providers may be required to collect fees from lienholders and their agents for the implementation and administration of the electronic lien system. The amount of the fee collected by a service provider and paid to a contractor for the establishment and maintenance of the electronic lien system must not exceed $4 per transaction. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A contractor may also serve as a service provider under such terms and conditions as are established by the Department pursuant to the terms of a contract entered into pursuant to this section and the regulations adopted by the Department. If a contractor will also serve as a service provider: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Department may perform audits of the contractor at intervals determined by the Department to ensure the contractor is not engaged in predatory pricing. The contractor shall reimburse the Department for the cost of all audits. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The contract between the Department and the contractor entered into pursuant to this section must include an acknowledgment by the contractor that the contractor is required to enter into agreements to exchange electronic lien data with all service providers who offer electronic lien and title services to lienholders doing business in the State of Nevada, have been approved by the Department for participation in the electronic lien system pursuant to this section and elect to use the contractor for access to the electronic lien system. A service provider must not be required to provide confidential or proprietary information to any other service provider. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except for persons who are not normally engaged in the business or practice of financing vehicles, all lienholders shall use the electronic lien system to process all notifications and releases of security interests through electronic batch file transfers. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For the purposes of this chapter, any requirement that a lien or other information appear on a certificate of title is satisfied by the inclusion of that information in an electronic file maintained in an electronic lien system. The satisfaction of a lien may be electronically transmitted to the Department. A certificate of title is not required to be issued until the lien is satisfied or the certificate of title is otherwise required to meet the requirements of any legal proceeding or other provision of law. If a vehicle is subject to an electronic lien, the certificate of title shall be deemed to be physically held by the lienholder for the purposes of state or federal law concerning odometer readings and disclosures. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A certified copy of the Departmentï¿½s electronic record of a lien is admissible in any civil, criminal or administrative proceeding in this State as evidence of the existence of the lien. If a certificate of title is maintained electronically in the electronic lien system, a certified copy of the Departmentï¿½s electronic record of the certificate of title is admissible in any civil, criminal or administrative proceeding in this State as evidence of the existence and contents of the certificate of title. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Director may adopt such regulations as are necessary to carry out the provisions of this section, including, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The amount of the fee a service provider is required to charge pursuant to subsection 4 and pay to a contractor for the establishment and maintenance of the electronic lien system. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The qualifications of service providers for participation in the electronic lien system. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The qualifications for a contractor to enter into a contract with the Department to establish, implement and operate the electronic lien system. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Program specifications that a contractor must adhere to in establishing, implementing and operating the electronic lien system. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Additional requirements for and restrictions upon a contractor who will also serve as a service provider. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Contractorï¿½ means a person who, pursuant to this section, enters into a contract with the Department to establish, implement and operate the electronic lien system. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Electronic lien systemï¿½ means a system to process the notification and release of security interests through electronic batch file transfers that is established and implemented pursuant to this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Service providerï¿½ means a person who, pursuant to this section, provides lienholders with software to manage electronic lien and title data.

and
